_comment: Entomology Mod - English (US) Translations - Complete Edition
specimen.entomology.bee.desc: A carefully captured bee for research.
specimen.entomology.silverfish.desc: A skittering silverfish preserved in a jar.
specimen.entomology.spider.desc: A common spider captured for study.
specimen.entomology.cave_spider.desc: A venomous cave spider from the depths.
specimen.entomology.endermite.desc: A rare endermite from The End dimension.
specimen.entomology.phantom.desc: An elusive phantom that haunts the night skies.
specimen.entomology.firefly.desc: A bioluminescent beetle that produces enchanting light.
specimen.entomology.monarch_butterfly.de: A beautiful migratory butterfly with distinctive orange wings.
specimen.entomology.beetle.desc: A hardy beetle with a tough exoskeleton.
specimen.entomology.cicada.desc: A loud insect known for its distinctive summer song.
specimen.entomology.fly.desc: A common flying insect found everywhere.
specimen.entomology.butterfly.desc: A graceful insect with colorful wings.
specimen.entomology.mosquito.desc: A blood-feeding insect active at night.
specimen.entomology.damselfly.desc: A delicate aquatic insect related to dragonflies.
research.entomology.bee.page: Bees are social insects that produce honey and pollinate flowers, essential for ecosystem health.
research.entomology.silverfish.page: Silverfish are elusive insects that thrive in dark, damp places and can infest stone blocks.
research.entomology.spider.page: Spiders are arachnids known for spinning webs to catch prey and climbing walls effortlessly.
research.entomology.cave_spider.page: Cave spiders are smaller and more venomous than their surface cousins, lurking in abandoned mineshafts.
research.entomology.endermite.page: Endermites are mysterious creatures from the End dimension, spawned by ender pearl teleportation.
research.entomology.phantom.page: Phantoms are undead flying creatures that attack sleepless players from the night sky.
research.entomology.firefly.page: Fireflies are bioluminescent beetles that produce light through chemical reactions, most active near water at night.
research.entomology.monarch_butterfly.pa: Monarch butterflies are migratory insects known for their orange and black wing patterns and dependence on milkweed.
research.entomology.beetle.page: Beetles are the largest insect order, featuring hardened wing covers and diverse ecological roles.
research.entomology.cicada.page: Cicadas are large insects famous for their loud mating calls and multi-year underground lifecycle.
research.entomology.fly.page: Flies are ubiquitous flying insects with exceptional agility and rapid reproduction rates.
research.entomology.butterfly.page: Butterflies are beautiful pollinators that undergo complete metamorphosis from caterpillar to winged adult.
research.entomology.mosquito.page: Mosquitoes are blood-feeding insects that breed in standing water and are most active at dusk and dawn.
research.entomology.damselfly.page: Damselflies are graceful aquatic insects with delicate bodies, often found near ponds and streams.
item.entomology.specimen_jar.deteriorate: §cThe specimen has deteriorated too much to release!
item.entomology.field_guide.title: §6=== Entomology Field Guide ===
item.entomology.bug_net.no_specimen: No specimen definition for this insect.
entomology.breeding.cooldown: §eThis insect needs more time before breeding again
entomology.guide.fly.title: §b=== FLY ===
entomology.guide.fly.description: §eSmall, agile insects found everywhere. They are attracted to food and organic matter.
entomology.guide.butterfly.title: §b=== BUTTERFLY ===
entomology.guide.butterfly.description: §eGraceful insects with colorful wings. Found in gardens and natural areas.
entomology.guide.mosquito.title: §b=== MOSQUITO ===
entomology.guide.mosquito.description: §cAggressive insects that bite players! Found near water sources, especially at night.
entomology.guide.cicada.title: §b=== CICADA ===
entomology.guide.cicada.description: §eLoud insects that produce distinctive calls. Spend years underground before emerging.
entomology.guide.damselfly.title: §b=== DAMSELFLY ===
entomology.guide.damselfly.description: §eDelicate flying insects found near water. Related to dragonflies but smaller and more graceful.
entomology.guide.beetle.title: §b=== BEETLE ===
entomology.guide.beetle.description: §eHardy insects with tough exoskeletons. Found near decaying wood and logs.
entomology.guide.firefly.title: §b=== FIREFLY ===
entomology.guide.firefly.description: §aBioluminescent beetles that produce magical light! Most active near water at night.
entomology.guide.monarch_butterfly.title: §b=== MONARCH BUTTERFLY ===
entomology.guide.monarch_butterfly.descr: §6Beautiful migratory butterflies with distinctive orange and black wings. Seek milkweed plants.
entomology.guide.bee.title: §b=== BEE ===
entomology.guide.bee.description: §eSocial insects that pollinate flowers and produce honey. Defensive when nest is disturbed.
entomology.guide.spider.title: §b=== SPIDER ===
entomology.guide.spider.description: §eWall-climbing arachnids that produce webs. Can climb any surface and become aggressive in darkness.
entomology.guide.cave_spider.title: §b=== CAVE SPIDER ===
entomology.guide.cave_spider.description: §cVenomous spiders found in abandoned mineshafts! Smaller but more dangerous than regular spiders.
entomology.guide.silverfish.title: §b=== SILVERFISH ===
entomology.guide.silverfish.description: §ePest insects that infest stone blocks. Call for reinforcements when attacked!
entomology.guide.endermite.title: §b=== ENDERMITE ===
entomology.guide.endermite.description: §dMysterious creatures from The End dimension. Spawned by ender pearl teleportation.
entomology.guide.phantom.title: §b=== PHANTOM ===
entomology.guide.phantom.description: §5Undead flying terrors that hunt players who haven't slept! Dive attack from the night sky.
entomology.guide.tips.title: §6=== CATCHING TIPS ===
entomology.guide.tips.1: §e• Use Bug Nets to catch insects
entomology.guide.tips.2: §e• Better nets have higher catch rates
entomology.guide.tips.3: §e• Insects at full health are harder to catch
entomology.guide.biomes.title: §6=== BIOME GUIDE ===
entomology.guide.activity.title: §6=== ACTIVITY GUIDE ===
entomology.guide.activity.weather: §e• Weather: Insects less active during rain
